business.headline: Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,500; Asian Paints up 2%Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,500; Asian Paints up 2%

SBI turns 70: Why bank's blue keyhole has stood the test of timeAfter independence, under the first 5-year plan's push for rural development, the government nationalised the Imperial Bank. On July 1, 1955, the State Bank of India was born under the State Bank of India Act.

MS Dhoni files for trademark of iconic nickname 'Captain Cool'Over the years, 'Captain Cool' has meant much more than just a catchy title. It sums up Dhoni's calm mind under pressure, from winning India's first T20 World Cup in 2007 to lifting the ODI World Cup in 2011 and the Champions Trophy in 2013.
Sensex ends 450 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Trent gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 452.44 points to close at 83,606.46, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 120.75 points, ending below the 25,600 mark.

Look rich or be rich: Startup founder on middle class dilemmaToday, many people in the middle class are busy trying to look rich, rather than actually becoming rich. Costly gadgets, fancy brunches and trendy holidays are often paid for with loans and EMIs, says founder and CEO, Shyam Achuthan.

8 years of GST: Top 5 achievements you should knowSince its launch, GST has strengthened India's revenue and expanded the taxpayer base, with collections reaching a record Rs 22.08 lakh crore in 2024–25, as per PIB.

IndusInd Bank submits CEO shortlist to RBI after leadership exits: ReportThe candidates include Rajiv Anand, Rahul Shukla, and Anup Saha — all experienced financial sector leaders. The move comes after the abrupt exits of CEO Sumant Kathpalia and deputy Arun Khurana in April, following a $230 million hit from years of misaccounting in internal derivative trades.

Rural India holds steady as urban consumption slows, finds Equirus SecuritiesThe mood remains subdued overall, but analysts note an undercurrent of recovery in rural pockets, led by fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), electric mobility and segments of real estate.

Filing ITR without a CA? 5 common mistakes that you must avoidMany people mix up the financial year and assessment year. For income earned in 2024-25, the assessment year will be 2025-26. Pick this carefully or your return will not be valid.

Terms agreed and locked, India-US trade deal likely before July 8The much-awaited deal comes just in the nick of time, as Trump's deadline for imposing reciprocal tariffs on countries worldwide ends on July 9. Last week, Trump said his administration was looking to remove all trade barriers, which he called 'unthinkable'.

Government's favourite baby: Investment banker on India's real estate boomInvestment banker Sarthak Ahuja says India's real estate sector isn't in a bubble—it's backed by policy, jobs, and demographics, making it a long-term priority for the government.

Explained: Why JB Chemicals shares plunged over 6% todayThe market reaction came swiftly after Torrent Pharmaceuticals announced it will acquire a controlling 46.39% stake in JB Pharma from global investment firm KKR, with plans to subsequently merge the two companies.

entertainment.headline: Heads of State review: Priyanka, John Cena, Idris Elba pack punches and punchlinesReleased-Wed Jul 02, 2025Heads of State movie review: 'Heads of State' is an engaging action comedy blending humour, emotion, and intense sequences. John Cena, Priyanka Chopra and Idris Elba lead a star-studded cast in a thrilling mission.

Kannappa box office Day 4: Vishnu Manchu's film faces disappointing Monday in IndiaActor Vishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa' had a disappointing Monday at the box office in India. The film saw a massive dip in numbers, but managed to rake in Rs 25 crore in four days in the country.

Ranbir Kapoor gets emotional as he wraps Nitesh Tiwari's RamayanaBollywood's much-anticipated film 'Ramayana', directed by Nitesh Tiwari and featuring Ranbir Kapoor and Sai Pallavi, has been wrapped. Ranbir addressed the cast and crew with a heartfelt speech.

Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit condemns Naseeruddin Shah's support for Diljit DosanjhFilmmaker Ashoke Pandit, in a recent interview, said that he was not surprised or shocked to see Naseerudddin Shah supporting Diljit Dosanjh amid 'Sardaar Ji 3' controversy. The casting of Pakistani actor Hania Aamir caused a widespread backlash against the singer-actor and the team.

Shefali Jariwala's last 24 hours: What went wrong and led to her death?Actor Shefali Jariwala, of 'Kaanta Laga' fame, reportedly died of a heart attack on June 27. Here's a detailed report about the sequence of events, as confirmed by our police sources.

Actor Saanvika refused kissing scene in Panchayat 4, says script was changedActor Saanvika, who plays Rinki in 'Panchayat', shared that she declined a kissing scene in Season 4 due to discomfort and the show's family-friendly appeal. The makers respected her decision and replaced the scene, maintaining the essence of her character without compromising her comfort.

Ram Kapoor denies losing weight to get more work, says my name is not KhanActor Ram Kapoor recently shared that he did not lose weight to get more work offers. He was in a conversation with filmmaker Farah Khan for her YouTube channel.

Kareena Kapoor shares her parents' decision to reunite after years apartKareena Kapoor expressed happiness at the decision of her parents, Randhir Kapoor and Babita, to spend their later years together. She said this reunion marks a full-circle moment for her and her sister Karisma.
Project Hail Mary trailer: Ryan Gosling is on a space mission to save the worldThe trailer of 'Project Hail Mary' starring Ryan Gosling is out. The film will release in India on March 20, 2026.

Sara Ali Khan, Aditya click selfies as they enjoy metro ride with fans. WatchSara Ali Khan and Aditya Roy Kapur enjoyed a metro ride with fans as they promote their upcoming film 'Metro In Dino.' The film will release in theatres on July 4.

Avika Gor's fiance calls her heroine of his story in sweet birthday postOn Avika Gor's 28th birthday, her fiance Milind Chandwani, shared a heartfelt message along with an unseen engagement photo, calling her the "heroine" of his story.

Neha Dhupia takes Vande Bharat to Surat, calls it a beautifully nostalgic rideNeha Dhupia recently took a nostalgic trip on the Vande Bharat Express from Mumbai to Surat. In a vlog, she shared the experience, fondly recalling childhood train journeys with her parents.

Revisiting Umrao Jaan: Why Rekha's musical still resonates with audiences todayDirector Muzaffar Ali's epic-drama 'Umrao Jaan' (1981), re-released in theatres on June 27. What makes the film still resonate with audiences after 44 years? A revisit of the film's enduring cinematic legacy, Rekha's soulful charm and musical nostalgia.

Devi Sri Prasad alleges Oo Antava was copied, fans point to Turkish singer AtiyeThe song 'Oo Antava', composed by Devi Sri Prasad, is from Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise' and featured Samantha Ruth Prabhu in a special appearance. Reportedly, the viral track has been copied by a Turkish artiste.

Poonam Dhillon defends Sridevi: She was brilliant, not dumb as media claimedVeteran actor Poonam Dhillon spoke about late actor Sridevi's image in the media in a recent interview. She defended Sridevi and said she was not as dumb as the media claimed.

Abhijeet Bhattacharya slams Diljit over old concert clip amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowSinger Abhijeet Bhattacharya slammed Diljit Dosanjh by sharing an old concert clip where he is seen reciting Rahat Indori's line, "Kisi ke baap ka Hindustan thodi hai." The post comes amid ongoing backlash against the 'Chamkila' star for working with Pakistani actor Hania Aamir in 'Sardaar Ji 3'.

Vijay Sethupathi, Nithya Menen's Thalaivan Thalaivii to release in JulyVijay Sethupathi and Nithya Menen reunite for the Tamil film 'Thalaivan Thalaivii', set to release on July 25. Directed by Pandiraaj, the movie promises a lively mix of comedy, action, and character-driven storytelling centred around a quirky tiffin centre.

Mandala Murders: Vaani Kapoor plays detective in crime-thriller on secret societiesThe new poster of Vaani Kapoor's 'Mandala Murders' was released on June 30. The mythological-crime thriller is scheduled to release on Netflix on July 25.

Subhash Ghai introduces Riteish Deshmukh as heroine of his next filmFilmmaker Subhash Ghai announced the end of his sabbatical on Monday with the announcement of his new film. He announced Bollywood actor Riteish Deshmukh as the heroine of his next film on Instagram.

general news.headline: Very strategic ally: White House says India-US trade deal announcement soonSpeaking at a press conference in the White House, Karoline Leavitt said the US-India trade deal is very close and final announcements will come soon.

Elon Musk shreds Trump's 'debt slavery bill', vows to launch America PartyElon Musk, once a close Trump ally and advisor, has been constantly lashing out at the President's 'Big Beautiful Bill', claiming it would add more than $3 trillion to the national debt.

Odisha bureaucrat beaten, dragged out of office; Naveen Patnaik tears into BJPA video shows Ratnakar Sahoo being manhandled by a group of young men, who can be heard abusing him inside the civic body office premises. The men also grabbed the bureaucrat by the collar of his shirt and dragged him out of the building.

Bhopal man kills live-in partner, hides body; confesses to friend while highIn Bhopal, a man strangled his live-in partner during a fight and later confessed the murder while drinking with a friend. Police arrested him and recovered the decomposing body from their rented home.

Naseeruddin Shah backs Diljit, slams political attacks, deletes post laterVeteran actor Naseeruddin Shah shared a post and backed Diljit Dosanjh amid the 'Sardaar Ji 3' controversy. The actor stated how such acts hamper personal interactions between Indians and Pakistanis. However, he deleted the post later.

FIR says Tamil Nadu temple guard had seizure while trying to flee custodyThe 27-year-old was picked up for questioning after a woman alleged that 80 gm of jewellery went missing from her car after she asked Ajit Kumar to park it.

China's Thousand Talents Plan: A weapon to win the tech raceIn the global race for tech supremacy, talent is the most valuable currency. And few countries have pursued it as aggressively or as strategically as China

Restore Indus treaty: Pakistan urges India, cites Court of Arbitration 'ruling'India has never recognised the proceedings at the Permanent Court of Arbitration after Pakistan raised objections to certain design elements of the two projects under the provisions of the Indus Waters Treaty.

Girl falls from Disney cruise's 4th deck, father jumps overboard to save herA father jumped into the ocean to save his daughter after she fell overboard from the fourth deck of the Disney Dream cruise ship on June 29. The crew rescued them after more than 10 minutes in the water. Passengers praised the father's bravery.

China says border dispute with India complicated, ready to discuss delimitationChinese Foreign Minister Mao Ning said that the border dispute is complicated and takes time to resolve. She said that Beijing is ready to hold discussions on delimitation.

No Bumrah, two spinners? India's training session hints at playing XI for 2nd TestIndia's training session at Edgbaston on Monday afternoon offered the clearest indication yet of a reshuffled playing XI for the second Test against England, starting 2 July. The visitors are expected to make at least two changes, with pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah almost certain to sit out as the management prioritises his workload.

Setback for INDIA bloc as Congress pushes to go solo in Mumbai civic body pollsThe leaders felt that the Congress risks being sidelined in the city if it contests elections to the cash-rich civic body along with its Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) allies - the Shiv Sena (Uddhav faction) and the NCP (Sharad Pawar faction) - leaving the Congress High Command in a quandary.

India's Agni-5 'bunker buster' missile to carry largest conventional warheadThe Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) is developing a modified version of the Agni-5 intercontinental ballistic missile. The new variant will be a conventional weapon capable of carrying a massive 7500-kilogram bunker-buster warhead.
Shux to make historic radio contact with India from space. Details hereThis ham radio session will allow students and engineers on the ground to interact directly with astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla.

Is Ravindra Jadeja, the all-rounder, a no-show in SENA Tests?Ravindra Jadeja, once part of a lethal spin duo with R Ashwin, struggled to make an impact in the Headingley Test. For all his match-winning feats at home and in the subcontinent, his effectiveness as a game-changer has faded in South Africa, England, New Zealand, Australia (SENA) conditions.

Boyfriend slits nursing student's throat in hospital, flees; video captures horrorThe nurse was murdered by her lover inside a hospital in Madhya Pradesh in broad daylight while hundreds of people watched but didn't intervene.

sports.headline: Nathan Lyon quits iconic Australian role after 12 years, opens up on retirementNathan Lyon has stepped down as the Australian cricket team's songmaster after 12 years. The off-spinner remains focused doing well for the Test team, signalling his intentions to play in India and England in 2027.

Yashasvi Jaiswal's Goa U-turn complete, opener to continue playing for MumbaiWhile Prithvi Shaw appears set to depart Mumbai ahead of the 2025–26 season, Yashasvi Jaiswal will continue to represent the domestic cricket heavyweights. Faf du Plessis scripts world record with second hundred after turning 40Faf du Plessis became the first T20 batter to score more then one hundred after turning 40. His stellar form helped Texas Super Kings defeat MI New York in a crunch Major League Cricket match in Dallas on Sunday, June 29.

Batting cage and tennis balls: Steve Smith fast tracks recovery before 2nd TestSteve Smith revealed that he trained in a New York baseball cage while recovering from his finger injury. Smith is in the running for a return in the 2nd Test match against West Indies.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
